title: Enterprise Data Architect
description:
The Enterprise Data Architect (EDA) primary goal is to keep data easily accessible and accurate. To meet that goal, the EDA reviews, refines and implements data standards. Examples of data standards include those that define how data is categorized or how codes are assigned to represent specific products, customers and other data types. Gathering information about data use in the workplace, the architect creates a blueprint or road map, showing processes and services that affect data use and data standards. The architect works with project managers and business stakeholders to implement that design.

The EDA is further expected to act as the team leader for the global DBA resources and provide them daily technical guidance and management. The role as EDA is hands on, relishing learning, provide guidance and create value added services for a data hungry organization Although the location of the position is in Newton, NJ, from time to time it may be required to undertake duties at other ThorLabs locations.

Essential Job Functions include the following, but are not limited to:

  • The EDA works with teams to solve business data problems.
  • The EDA develops data modeling methods, databases, data warehouses, data lakes, master data and metadata.
  • The EDA acts as a data evangelist to address business process improvement with users in finance, purchasing, quality, human resources and other departments. In addition to the essential functions and duties listed above, all positions are also responsible for:
  • Meeting company standards pertaining to quantity and quality of work performed on an ongoing basis, performing all work related tasks in a manner that is in compliance with all Company policies and procedures.
  • Adhering to Company policies, procedures, and directives regarding standards of workplace behavior in completing job duties and assignments. The Company retains the right to change or assign other duties to this position. Physical Activities: This is largely a sedentary role; however, some filing is required. This would require the ability to lift files, open filing cabinets and bend or stand as necessary.

Qualifications

Experience:

  • 10+ years of experience in database design, data warehousing and data modeling

Education:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering/Science, or equivalent work experience.

Specialized Knowledge and Skills:

  • Prior experience as DBA architect
  • Experience with the MS SQL stack - SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, Azure Synapse, Azure Analysis Services etc.
  • Knowledge of ERP system databases, preferable MS Dynamics/Axapta.
  • Comes from a mixed heterogeneous SQL environment
  • Knowledge of project management
  • Experience with data modeling software
  • Experience with migrating to cloud, preferably Azure
  • Communicate directly with users, speaking in terms they understand
  • Should have good business knowledge and be able to explain technical concepts without using complex, technical terms.

Please be sure to complete an application on the Company’s career site for consideration. Direct link provided below:

https://recruiting.myapps.paychex.com/appone/MainInfoReq.asp?R_ID=3429023

Thorlabs values its diverse environment and is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified individuals will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identify or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age or veteran status. Job descriptions are not intended as and do not create employment contracts. The organization maintains its status as an at-will employer. Employees can be terminated for any reason not prohibited by law.

title: Fullstack Product Engineers (Mid - Senior Levels) Remote
description:
WW is looking for candidates to help change people’s lives. We are a global wellness technology company inspiring millions of people to adopt healthy habits for real life. We do this through engaging digital experiences, face-to-face workshops, and sustainable programs that encourage people to move more, shift their mindset, and eat healthier while enjoying the foods they love. By drawing on over five decades of experience and expertise in behavioral science, we build communities in order to deliver wellness for all.

Role Overview:

To help us achieve our goals, we are seeking a Senior Software Engineer to join our team. You will leverage your knowledge to develop new consumer-focused products using modern Engineering such as Agile development, Continuous Integration, and Deployment, Microservices, etc. As a Senior Software Engineer at WW, your code, designs, and decisions will be highly visible, and will directly impact and delight our users.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Program daily in Node.js, Express, React, GraphQL, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, and others
  • Build out restful endpoints and lightweight aggregation layers
  • Build out new features and iterate on existing features
  • Design and implement low-latency, high-availability, and performance applications
  • Help define architectures and design patterns
  • Participate in code reviews
  • Answer technical inquiries on codebase and product requirements
  • Lead the way with writing programmatic unit and integration tests
  • Work closely with tech leads, product managers, and design teams
  • Full responsibility for developing, testing, and deploying using our ci/cd tools

Qualifications:

  • Real world web and service development experience
  • Deep experience with content modeling
  • Experience with modern frameworks such as React, Node.js, Express
  • Experience with web services API integration (GraphQL, Rest, JSON, XML)
  • Experience with responsive HTML & CSS frameworks such as bootstrap
  • Understanding of general user experience and UI design principles
  • Ability to understand requirements and map to technical implementation
  • Relational and/or NoSQL database experiences such as MySQL, Postgres, or Mongodb
  • Solid foundation in data structures, algorithms, and software design
  • Strong track record of shipping products
  • Knowledge of streaming services like Kafka or Kinesis will be a huge plus
  • Experience with Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery (CI/CD). Github Actions will be a plus
  • Proficient understanding of code versioning tools such as GIT, SVN, etc
  • Experience with Docker and Amazon Web Services a plus
  • Experience with open source Content Management Systems such as Drupal, WordPress, Keystone are all pluses
  • Experience with Swagger/OAS documentation a huge plus
  • Experience in mentoring and leading other Engineers
  • Computer science degree or equivalent academic or professional background

WW is an equal opportunity employer. WW does not discriminate on the basis of sex, race, color, creed, national origin, marital status, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.

title: Senior Frontend Engineer
description:
Quadio, an exciting new ecosystem of IRL and digital businesses designed to champion college creativity, is looking to expand its tech team as it rapidly advances v2 of its mobile-first app toward release. Founded in 2019 by an EDM producer with a passion for innovation and artistic collaboration and a Cornell grad with stints in strategy and marketing at Twitter and BlizzardActivision, Quadio’s team has grown to 24 strong, with a renowned board of advisors and strong financial funding. With a culture of creativity, urgency, and candor, Quadio seeks a wicked-smart, super-energized engineer who loves the arts and the people who make them come to life, embraces intensity and challenge with enthusiasm, and finds transparency as refreshing as we do. Our in-house motto is, “LET’S GOOOO,” and if that kind of positivity appeals to you, read on.

Responsibilities

  • Implement the features and user experiences that power Quadio’s web and mobile applications
  • Architect efficient and reusable front-end systems that drive complex applications
  • Collaborate closely with our Design, Marketing, and Product teams to build an engaging user experience for our users
  • Build products and experiences people love through intuitive design and clear user experiences
  • Take your ideas from concept to reality
  • Put automated testing, tracking, and monitoring in place to ensure our systems are always working as expected

Experience

  • A minimum of 5 years of experience developing applications using Javascript/Typescript, including advanced knowledge of concepts like asynchronous programming, closures, types, and ES2015+
  • Expertise in React Native, with experience in build and release pipelines - specifically publishing applications across both Apple’s iStore and Google’s Play Store.
  • Expertise in browser APIs and optimizing for frontend performance
  • Experience working with RESTful APIs and/or GraphQL as well as client/server architectures

Additional (Standout Qualifications)

  • Experience with frontend state management frameworks such as Redux, MobX-state-tree, or Vuex
  • Experience in bridging React Native components across Java/Kotlin and/or Swift
  • Experience with frontend frameworks like React, AngularJS, Vue.js, or another equivalent framework
  • Expertise in HTML & CSS, with a knack for layout, specificity, cross-browser compatibility, and accessibility
  • Experience with AWS APIs, such as DynamoDB, Lambda, or CDK
  • Excited about the opportunities and challenges of working on projects touching all areas of our codebase and associated microservices
  • Experience with containerization tools, such as Docker or Kubernetes
  • BS/MS in Computer Science or an equivalent major

company: ALDI Einkauf SE & Co. oHG Loading
title: DevOps Engineer (m/w/d)
description:
Das sind deine Aufgaben

  • Umsetzung von DevOps für eine Cloud-basierte Analytics Plattform
  • Aufbau automatischer Tools zu Orchestrierung, Monitoring und Entstörung automatisierter Daten- und Analysestrecken
  • Optimierung existierender Datenbeladungsprozessen und ggf. Überführung in einen modernen Zielzustand
  • Einhaltung von datenbezogenen Prioritäten zur Sicherstellung optimaler Verfügbarkeit der verschiedenen Daten zur richtigen Zeit
  • Überwachung der Auslastung der Plattformkomponenten und Ableitung geeigneter Maßnahmen zur Performanceproblemen
  • Dokumentation und Wissensvermittlung zu den Datenstrecken und deren Orchestrierung
  • Anbindung und Aufbau neuer Daten- und Analysestrecken durch Mitarbeit in cross-funktionalen, agilen Projektteams zur Realisierung von Use Cases
  • Enge Zusammenarbeit mit Data Engineering, Modelling und Quality

Das bringst du mit

  • Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation mit technischem Schwerpunkt
  • Mehrjährige Erfahrung mit dem Aufsetzen von Cloud-Umgebungen für und dem Einsatz von DevOps-Technologien für das Data Management oder Analytics Use Cases
  • Fundierte Kenntnisse in den Bereichen ETL/ELT, SQL, Automatisierungstechnologien und Software Engineering Methodiken
  • Ausgeprägte technische und analytische Fähigkeiten, hohe Methodenkompetenz
  • Hohe Kommunikations- und Beratungsstärke
  • Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift

Das bieten wir dir

  • Top-Branchengehalt
  • Eine abwechslungsreiche und anspruchsvolle Tätigkeit
  • Einen sicheren Arbeitsplatz bei der Nr. 1 im Discount
  • Ein leistungsstarkes und angenehmes Arbeitsumfeld in einem Team, das sich auf dich freut!

Interessiert?

Klick hier um zum Bewerbungsformular zu gelangen!
